Can put css variables in a css variable. This was only breaking in prod because of how our local variable setup works
URL param is dynamic, server can't render this because we clip on a circle, makes more sense for the client to do it.
Yet another iteration of pipeline limitations. We're dealing with a number of factors, but the biggest change here is:
Previously we were migrating lead routes to ENTITY_CHANGED triggers, when really they should be STAGE_CHANGED triggers.
- Simplified helper method function definition – can infer the length of the selected contacts instead of passing it in.
Need to figure out why the plan-comparison css file isn't being created, but this should paper around the problem for now
- This matches the pipeline list - we don't need a container here and this reduces the pixels on the screen significantly.
- Fixed useEffect to only reset for props (the other parts were redundant and covered in the useEffect in prospector-page)
"contact/accountEmails" - these had a different format that we missed when migrating over to a shared system w/ lead cards.
Some of these are duplicated, but we're inconsistent on viewbox, fill color (not all are currentColor, etc) so this unifies that.
This also improves our prevention system to show a list of reasons instead of just "required items" since some can't be fixed now.
NOTE: This does not work. We believe that GraphQL does not support two layers of inherentence (at least when it comes to Interfaces)
This was caused by analytics status failing. This frontend should not be crashing the page, but this fixes the erroring query first.
About to replace, but still used in email sequence template v1 list, don't want to go through effort of deleting that branch of code
This commit also reworks the pipeline list to tell people how many pipelines are hidden, using the canAccess (or lack thereof) property
We don't wanna use "new" anymore, and we want to forcibly redirect away from the old billing page, in case there are dotcom links to it.
Memoizing a few obvious things, should probably move schema up in the chain but don't need to do this for performance (just better code)
- Decided not to use HTML parsing to insert the two tags, since it's slow and needs to happen on each load. The strpos is jank but works.
This stupid const was hidden - this makes Italy appear when selecting 'State' as the top-level location filter type under 'Exact location'
We had a jank modal that predated our new timeline styling, and we never went back and unified the two. This commit removes that entirely.
Empty white space was being created by this commit: https://github.com/nutshellcrm/nutshell/commit/e72ce03050d9dbfe4c46d68f2eb436d29aad615d
We now load the MCFX analytics script dynamically too instead of on publish. Because of this, we now strip the existing one dynamically too
Fixes some routes, and makes the SMS marketing setup process a bit more 'marketing'-focused - using Broadcast terminology and some redirects
This is expected, and we shouldn't be throwing an error when this occurs. Too much noise. Eventually we should warn users, but not right now.
I'd love to be able to show this to select internal instances as documentation. We hide this for security reasons so it should stay internal.
For MCFX customers that just have access to Nutshell Campaigns, they need the ability to edit domains and sender addresses. This provides that.
Fixes a regression where all three marketing cross sell pages were enabled for everyone, intention is only for the SEO scan to be available to all
Wires up the PagePreview mutation, as well as PagePreview action, which in turn calls HtmlMaterialize. Need to add tests, but wanted to get a POC up
We need this for legacy reasons. This specifically fixes an error from the outlook extension where we expect the fields array to contain the `owner` key
In order to do this, we simply needed to support this on the backend, which was _pretty much_ there (the PHP return types were right) but the code wasn't
Since we stopped showing character count when unfocused, the merge field button couldn't be clicked because the click would unfocus and unmount the popover.
Only want to show this for 'always-on' or 'invisible' mode. The real goal here is to provide confidence invisible mode is even doing anything for customers.
This adds a data-type-form to every Nutshell form in hopes of making it easier for the event capturing done via MCFX to know where the form is originating from
https://github.com/nutshellcrm/nutshell/commit/b01775b7d83c1a08c8f0856d27cb1d7ffb38c78b#diff-aa5ed3b1c5a0e94035c4e798aa91ca55b95746591e06272fd889d0e88cbda3b5L8
overflow: hidden combined with our content not quite matching is causing a bug where focusing the BEE editor shifts the compare content bar behind the status bar.
Nothing was broken, but Flow couldn't handle spiraling card updates (e.g. changes to existing shells) and it was slowing down our workflow within the web directory.
The rcmoobile app has fallen out of fashion, and the 'right' way to do this is to let the user configure their computer to open tel: links w/ the new RingCentral App
Some instances don't have pinned domains, but they still have user emails on contacts. These are fundamentally the same as internal addresses, so we should mark them as such
Not sure why this broke in the new nav, likely a DOM ordering problem. There's only a few of these left in the old world that are affected, so just blocklisted certain events
We changed the way audiences and tags are configured on the backend, and never updated this jank javascript to make it work. Didn't feel like refactoring was worth it right now.
MCFX has a help widget in the bottom right corner, occasionally we have an Intercom widget down there, etc – we shouldn't hide stuff in that corner, so moving the save button up.
This fixes a regression where changing settings filters _after_ other filters were applied wouldn't reset selection. Any filter that triggers a re-query should reset the selection.
We previously encoded the phone number for the old RC app. Not sure if we needed to or not, but NOW the numbers do not need to be URL encoded to work with the 2024 RingCentral client.
OOC = out of credits. We think telling people they're using a credit every time they click the button is more annoying than being shown you can't do anything unexpectedly after 5 usages
Mainly for WebFX, but this adds the ability to setup a goal where an audience member is added to an audience. Sometimes helpful when transitioning members from one audience to the next.
Our "empty state" is more on an onboarding state. This adds an additional CTA to the empty state which then shows a more helpful "tell the user what to do" state to get them adding filters.
Because this ratio wasn't 16:9, it was scaling horribly, causing the rendered height to be fractional pixels and not looking centered. I believe this to be a safe change based on some cursory QA
This commit unshares 6 components shared via shells to both web and email by re-creating dummy components (that do nothing) as placeholders until we're ready to re-commit to our email extension.
We recently added a getAction to the EmailController, but because of our loose routing rules and the fact it was above the cgetReportAction, it was being improperly hit when requesting the report.

We expected _some_ value from our omni-save of the setup form, and since that UI was behind it flag it wasn't saving. Since this has been released for all, removing the code instead of fixing the code.

This is deprecated, don't want to show "coming soon" for a feature that's not being developed. Don't want to allow users to reconfigure domains and competitors since we don't query for the data anymore.

We were hitting Recurly for plans but not really using anything from Recurly that can't be hardcoded. We already have a reliance on 5 hardcoded keys for the comparison, so felt right to avoid a live API call

Just because classic is less money doesn't mean Foundation (previously to the right) is an upgrade. We want to convey this to classic customers. Our plans API provides the "correct" order which is by capability

Tough choice here, but I did this because I'm anticipating these changing based on design feedback and other requirements as this feature progresses, and wanted to optimize for speedy iteration and fewer moving parts

Fixes a bug where we weren't providing react select with default options, so without typing it looked to the user like there weren't tags. I'm not 100% sure why this wasn't always happening, but didn't try to figure it out

Unfortunately, this also means removing some of the most helpful behavior from it which is no longer supported. We now hard delete MCFX form submission raw data once its processed, which means we can't show it here anymore.

We've decided that the act of previewing landing pages changes should trigger a "materialize" action of the bee body json, so this makes the landing page preview component fire a _mutation_ rather than a query, for semantics

This commit fixes a WIP "form preview" page that was never working, and updates our layouts so that we have a single "full page preview" layout that is responsible for taking an entityName and entityId and rendering the correct content.

The way BEE is configured is via the same bee.start() method, but instead passing a different token for landing pages. This commit adds a param to our token query to allow for dynamic initialization of BEE products (email vs. landing pages)

We purposefully hide the tooltip when dragging occurs, but this shouldn't happen at the RenderedValue level, but rather when someone actually goes to drag. This commit prevents the tooltip from rebuilding on every render, which was insanely slow

This removes the react-joyride package from client/web, along with all demo silo joyride code. There's an additional main-app joyride that was removed (email sequence template onboarding) that I didn't think was worth keeping around to maintain.

Previously if the analytics status request wasn't finished we wouldn't try to show page content. This is bad UX in general and feels slower than it needs to, but if this request fails the page content never loads, which is not necessary to prevent

Rips out the HashRouter (not recommended to use anymore) in favor of a simple index state. Might not be the best solution but gets everything working. Goal here is to make it so hitting "Next" saves, and routes to the next slide on callback success

There's a bug here that puts every new stream content on a newline. This is because our ReactQuill component will slap a

tag around any changes and treat it like HTML. Going to have to get creative on preventing this behaivor since it's all internal

13 years ago we decided to throw an exception when asking for the loggedByUser, but in our GraphQL world we want to request this frequently. Current patterns point us towards just returning `null` and handling this closer to the source if we want to throw an exception.

I believe this is caused because our inner-container's height is slightly too big, and the way the browser decides how to render overflow: hidden changes when we focus something in the bee editor (I think they scroll something into position?) – either way, adds a jank fix to make this work.

We've tried a few things to get GTM working inside of landing pages, and it usually works, but there are situations where child scripts get loaded via GTM-loaded scripts, and if those don't implement the 'nonce' security tag then it doesn't work for us. This is a slegehammer approach that will allow us to omit passing our CSP to any instance we deem secure via a setting in the DB.

We're calling out of shells to a redux-form related component, which I believe is somehow increasing the surface area of our flow coverage (good) but some of the new area started to fail. Some errors required upgrading from redux-form 8.1.0 to 8.2.3 (https://github.com/redux-form/redux-form/issues/4434, specifically we needed) and then the other errors required slightly better typing on our end. No functionality changes in this commit.
